data.title: Directions and Parking
data.meta_description: Driving directions, parking and transportation information for the National Constitution Center.
data.text:
National Constitution Center Parking Garage

Enter from Race Street between 5th Street and 6th Street.

The National Constitution Center's parking garage is open seven days a week, 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. Please note, the parking garage closes at 5 p.m. daily, but parkers may access the garage after hours via a callbox.

*The garage may extend its hours for evening programs.

Effective March 20, 2024:

Rates

Up to one hour $13 Up to three hours $22 Up to 24 hours $25 *Early bird (enter between 6 a.m. and 9 a.m.)

This rate is only valid Mondays through Fridays $15

Become a Member at the National Patriot level or above and save on parking.

Member Rates

National Patriot, Constitution Founder, Constitution Guardian, and 1787 Patrons' Circle (flat-rate) $10 Delegates' Circle and above Free

Join today

Independence Visitor Center Parking Garage

Enter from 6th Street between Arch Street and Market Street.

For hours and rates, visit the IVC website.

SEPTA

The Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority offers a vast option of transit services, including buses, trolleys, trackless trolleys, subways, and regional rail.

To get to the National Constitution Center, use the Market-Frankford Line subway and get off at 5th Street Station, or use the Route 38, Route 44, or Route 48 buses.

For more information, call 215.580.7800 or visit septa.org.

Receive a $2 discount off regular adult admission when you present your valid SEPTA TrailPass, TransPass, One Day Independence Pass, or SEPTA Employee ID. Must be redeemed in person at the National Constitution Center admissions desk.

PATCO

The Port Authority Transit Corporation offers a high-speed train line between Southern New Jersey and Philadelphia.

To get to the National Constitution Center, use the PATCO Speedline and get off at 8th Street Station.

For more information, call 856.772.6900 or visit ridepatco.org.

Amtrak

Amtrak provides train service to 30th Street Station in Philadelphia. 30th Street Station also provides access to SEPTA public transit.

For more information, call 800.USA.RAIL or visit amtrak.com.

Phlash

The Phlash is a quick, easy, and inexpensive connection to key Philadelphia historic attractions and cultural institutions. The bright purple trolley stops at 6th and Market Streets near the National Constitution Center.

For more information and the seasonal schedule, call 800.537.7676 or visit phillyphlash.com.
